src:
Percepat Pembangunan Daerah, Pemkab Kubar Naikkan Dana Desa Hingga 4 Kali Lipat
06 Nov 2019, 22:51 by Andreas Trisno



Percepat Pembangunan Daerah, Pemkab Kubar Naikkan Dana Desa Hingga 4 Kali Lipat



Percepat Pembangunan Daerah, Pemkab Kubar Naikkan Dana Desa Hingga 4 Kali Lipat


KBRN, Sendawar : Pemerintah Kabupaten Kutai Barat (Kubar) memberikan perhatian serius terhadap pembangunan daerah pinggiran atau pedesaan dan kampung. Salah satunya dengan mengucurkan tambahan anggaran untuk desa hingga empat kali lipat. Anggaran tersebut diluar dari dana desa (DD) yang bersumber dari Anggaran Pendapatan dan Belanja Negara (APBN) pusat.
“Dulu ADK (Alokasi Dana Kampung) paling tinggi Rp 200 juta, tapi sekarang kami naikan rata-rata Rp 800 juta per kampung. Tinggal kepala kampung (desa) kreatif, inovatif membangun Kampung Anya,” jelas Bupati Kubar FX.Yapan di Sendawar Rabu (6/11/2019).
FX.Yapan menyebut rata-rata tiap desa di Kubar mengelolah dana antara Rp 1,5 sampai Rp 2 miliar per tahun. Terdiri dari dana ADK yang bersumber dari APBD Kabupaten dan APBN atau dana pusat. Jika di total dari 190 desa yang tersebar di 16 kecamatan Se-Kubar, maka rata-rata tiap tahun dana yang berputar di desa hampir Rp 300 miliar.
“Memang sudah kita naikan dalam tiga tahun terakhir sejak kami duduk sebagai bupati (2016). Supaya pembangunan bisa merata. Karen fokus kita sekarang adalah membangun daerah pinggiran,” katanya.
FX. Yapan menilai pemanfaatan desa lebih tepat sasaran dan menyentuh langsung kebutuhan masyarakat. Diharapkan dengan kucuran dana ini, desa sebagai unit terkecil dalam pemerintahan bisa mengelolanya dan melakukan pengembangan serta pembangunan secara mandiri. Sehingga ketimpangan yang terjadi antara masyarakat desa dengan masyarakat lainnya dapat berkurang.
“Kita tidak ingin masyarakat itu jadi objek pembangunan tapi subjek pembangunan. Maka kita anggarakan ADK naik termasuk juga honor-honor aparat kampung kita naikan. Supaya memberi motivasi dan inovasi karena kita bertanggungjawab secara moral kepada masyarakat. Bagaimana membangun dengan maksimal sesuai kebutuhan mereka,” katanya.
Bupati menyebut infrastruktur di pedesaan baik untuk akses transportasi, pendidikan, kesehatan hingga sentra usaha masyarakat belum memadai. Apalagi di Kutai Barat memiliki 190 desa yang tersebar di 16 Kecamatan yang tentunya banyak yang harus dibenahi.
“Karena itulah kita tidak ingin membangun sentralistik atau hanya di kota saja. Tapi sudah kami petakan daerah mana yang belum tersentuh pembangunan disitu yang kita prioritaskan. Dan ini betul-betul sesuai kebutuhan bukan kepentingan,” lanjut Yapan.
Diketahui pemkab Kubar menganggarkan ADK masing-masing desa sekitar 600-800 juta per tahun atau sekitar Rp 130-150 miliar per tahun. Sementara dana desa yang bersumber dari APBN juga meningkat dalam tiga tahun terakhir.
“Tahun 2017 dana desa Untuk Kubar 149,7 miliar. Lalu di 2018 DD kita Rp 148,1 Miliar. Tahun 2019 ini naik jadi Rp 173 miliar,”, sebut Agung, tenaga profesional pendamping desa kabupaten Kubar.
Sejumlah kepala desa di Kubar juga menyambut antusias dengan hadirnya perhatian pemerintah melalui program dana desa baik dari pusat maupun kabupaten.
“Tahun 2018 kami dapat dana ADK Rp 683 juta. Dana desanya Rp 697 juta jadi totalnya Rp 1,4 m. Sudah kami bangun semenisasi jalan kampung 303 meter lebar 4 meter. Terus pembukaan badan jalan sepanjang 1 km, pembangunan gedung posyandu ukuran 7x12 m. Dan masih banyak lagi yang sudah kami bangun dari dana desa ini. Itu sangat-sangat membantu percepatan pembangunan di desa kami”, ujar Petrus kepala kampung Ombau Asa kecamatan Barong Tongkok.
“Kalau untuk 2019 ini DD 790 juta, ADK 683 juta. Memang kalau yang dari pusat kan sudah ada program prioritasnya. Kalau yang daerah itu sebagian untuk operasional dan kita tambah lagi untuk pmbangunan.
“Kalau honor aparat kampung sekarang paling sedikit Rp 4 juta sampai 6 juta per bulan. Itu terdiri dari penghasilan tetap ditambah tunjangan. Jadi sekarang ini sudah lebih tinggi, kalau kita banding 4 tahun lalu jauh sekali”, tuturnya.
“Belasan tahun kita tidak nikmati pembangunan tapi sekarang ini terbantu dengan dana desa dan bena-benar dirasakan masyarakat,” tambah kades Intu Lingau Kecamatan Nyuatan Abet Nego.
text:
Accelerating Regional Development, Kubar Regency Government Increases Village Funds Up to 4 Times
Nov 6 2019, 22:51 by Andreas Trisno



Accelerating Regional Development, Kubar Regency Government Increases Village Funds Up to 4 Times



Accelerating Regional Development, Kubar Regency Government Increases Village Funds Up to 4 Times


KBRN, Sendawar: The Government of West Kutai Regency (Kubar) gives serious attention to the development of rural or rural areas and villages. One of the ways is by providing additional funds for the village up to four times. The budget is outside the village fund (DD) sourced from the central State Revenue and Expenditure Budget (APBN).
"Previously, ADK (Village Fund Allocation) was at the highest Rp 200 million, but now we are raising an average of Rp 800 million per village. All that remains is the creative, innovative village head building Anya Village, "explained the Regent of Kubar FX. Yapan in Sendawar Wednesday (11/06/2019).
FX.Yapan mentioned that on average each village in Kubar managed funds of between Rp 1.5 to Rp 2 billion per year. Consists of ADK funds sourced from the District APBD and APBN or central funds. If in a total of 190 villages spread across 16 sub-districts of Se-Kubar, then on average each year the revolving fund in the village is almost Rp 300 billion.
"Indeed we have raised it in the last three years since we sat as regent (2016). So that development can be distributed evenly. Because our focus now is to develop the periphery, "he said.
FX. Yapan assessed that the use of villages is more targeted and directly touches the needs of the community. It is hoped that with this funding, the village as the smallest unit in the government can manage it and carry out development and development independently. So that inequality that occurs between rural communities with other communities can be reduced.
"We do not want the community to be the object of development but the subject of development. So, we assume that ADK will increase, including the honorariums of our village officials to increase. In order to provide motivation and innovation because we are morally responsible to the community. How to build to the maximum according to their needs, "he said.
The Regent said that infrastructure in rural areas for access to transportation, education, health, and community business centers was inadequate. Moreover, in West Kutai it has 190 villages spread across 16 subdistricts which of course many have to be addressed.
"That is why we do not want to be centralized or just in the city. But we have already mapped which areas have not been touched by development there that we prioritized. And this is really in accordance with the needs not the interests, "continued Yapan.
It is known that the district government of Kubar allocates ADK for each village around 600-800 million per year or around Rp 130-150 billion per year. While village funds sourced from the state budget have also increased in the last three years.
"In 2017 village funds for Kubar 149.7 billion. Then in 2018 our DD is Rp.18.1 billion. In 2019 this will increase to Rp 173 billion, "said Agung, the professional assistant of the Kubar district village.
A number of village heads in Kubar also enthusiastically welcomed the presence of government attention through the village fund program from both the central and district levels.
"In 2018 we got ADK funds of Rp. 683 million. The village funds are Rp. 697 million, so the total is Rp. 1.4 m. We have built semenisasi village road 303 meters wide by 4 meters. Continue to open the road for 1 km, the construction of a 7x12 m posyandu building. And there are many more that we have built from this village fund. That really helps accelerate development in our village, "said Petrus, head of the Ombau Asa village, Barong Tongkok sub-district.
"For 2019 DD 790 million, ADK 683 million. Indeed, if there is a priority program from the center, right? If the area is partly operational, we add more to the building.
"The honorarium for village officials is now at least Rp. 4 million to 6 million per month. It consists of fixed income plus benefits. So now it is higher, if we compare it 4 years ago it is very far, "he said.
"We have not enjoyed development in dozens of years, but now it is helped by village funds and is truly felt by the community," added the village head of Intu Lingau, Nyuatan Abet Nego sub-district.
